attributes.action: explain why living in Britain is like poking your own eyes with needles every day
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Mr Brown, here is a (partial) list of fiscally messed up Britain:
*over 60s get winter fuel payments not matter how rich they are but a terminally ill 59 year old does not
*fuel duty in the UK is amongst the highest in the world yet it is regressive and never ever comes down, even when the price is £1.20 a litre
*the banks we bailed out won't lend to the public yet are allowed to bankroll the takeover of British companies by American ones (e.g. Kraft & Cadburys)
*Millions are spent on promoting healthy living (e.g. quit smoking adverts, vouchers for pregnant women, etc) yet there are fast food restaurants in our hospitals
*MS, Alzheimers, Parkinson's and Dementia sufferers who were unfortunate enough not have life insurance live miserable lives supported by forgotten carers, (or waste away in decrepit care homes) 
*Meanwhile MPs actually thought it was OK to claim money for toilet seats, duck houses, moats etc.
Mr Brown, please explain why the above are allowed to take place.

rejection.details: The title of your petition must make a point about government policy.
reasons: Statements that don't actually request any action
